message: Added Python package files and README
Added docs outline, installation instructions and README outline

Moved the documentation from eradiate-legacy, including README.md and fixed a typo in scenes/builder/base.py
Also added autodocs for eradiate.scenes.builder module
Set up automated docs deployment on readthedocs.io

Docker: Refactor the Docker image build, automation and documentation (#94)

* Docker: Refactor the Docker image build, automation and documentation

Docker images for Eradiate were scattered accross different repositories.
Their structure was missing an easy configuration and build method.
Build automation was only available internally at Rayference.

This patch solves these issues by bringing the folloing feature:
 - A centralised docker-compose file at Eradiate repository root "docker-build.yml"
 - Usage of env variables to specify some build parameters
 - A "docker" folder containing all the necessary Dockerfiles
 - A gihub workflow which builds the images everyday at 23:42 and for each tag of the form v*.*.*, and push them to docker-hub
 - Documentation update to reproduce the build internally
 - (external) A new, properly named docker hub account to store the images: rayference
 - A nice badge on the README to be informed of any build failure

* Remove jupyter lab install command

Co-authored-by: Nicolas Misk <nicolas.misk@rayference.eu>
